title: Japan's PM Sanae Takaichi set to win big in snap legislative elections
subhed: Polls show the Liberal Democratic Party (PLD) of Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi on course for a decisive victory in the February 8 legislative elections.

title: Epstein scandal prompts Jack Lang to offer resignation as head of the World Arab Institute
Trump shares racist video depicting the Obamas as monkeys, leaving White House scrambling
The stigma that surrounds 'slut shaming' persists
subhed: Maïa Mazaurette, a columnist at Le Monde, reviews 'Slut Shaming,' the latest book from Ovidie. The writer traces the fallout from the 'porno chic' movement, an era when transgression ruled, while also warning against the 'sex-positive' feminism that followed.

title: French companies cut down on drinking at work
subhed: Abstinence is gaining traction in France, including among employers. The electric utility company EDF banned alcohol consumption on all sites, prompting internal protest.
byline: By Frédéric Brillet and Anne Rodier

title: Robert Crumb, comic book author: 'I am a paranoid person and I make fun of that'
subhed: In 'Tales of Paranoia,' the legend of American counterculture comics takes readers on a dizzying journey into the world of madness, illustrated with a case study: Robert Crumb.

title: 'Heated Rivalry': Star-crossed love between two ice hockey players
subhed: The series, which has enjoyed massive success in Canada, brings a gay romance to the traditionally masculine world of ice hockey.

Bad Bunny, the anti-Trump icon made in Puerto Rico
subhed: On Sunday, in front of tens of millions of television viewers, the Puerto Rican reggaeton phenomenon will headline the Super Bowl halftime show, on the heels of winning Album of the Year at the Grammys. But, at a time when the ruthless crackdown on undocumented immigrants is raging in the US, inviting this Latin icon to one of America's major events was always bound to anger Donald Trump.

title: Iranian photojournalist shares unseen images of Tehran protests
subhed: Images that capture the scale of the brutally suppressed protests that swept Iran between December 28 and January 11 are rare. Some NGOs report at least 18,000 people dead. Iranian photographer Yalda Moaiery managed to transmit her images of the January 8 demonstrations and the funeral of a man killed by the regime.

title: Richard Reeves, the researcher studying the suffering of the modern man
subhed: Keen to combat the exploitation of male discontent by the far right, Reeves, who founded the American Institute for Boys and Men think tank, wrote a book that explains the appeal of this political current to men.

title: Epstein scandal tarnishes former minister Jack Lang and France's image
